adjective.description: Concerning the writing, study, or content of literature, especially of the kind valued for quality of form.
examples: the great literary works of the nineteenth century

adjective.description: (of language) associated with literary works or other formal writing; having a marked style intended to create a particular emotional effect.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense relating to the letters of the alphabet): from Latin litterarius, from littera (see letter).
